taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start in a high-availability deployment. The default configuration of the service (serviced) is to start when the host starts. This procedure is only needed after stopping serviced to perform maintenance tasks.

step.cmd: Log in to the primary node .
step.info: In this context, the primary node is the node that was the current node when you stopped .

step.cmd: Take the cluster out of standby mode.
Monitor the status of cluster resources.
step.stepresult: Monitor the status until all resources report Started. Resolve any issues before continuing.

step.cmd: Identify the hosts in the ZooKeeper ensemble.
step.stepresult: The result is a list of 1, 3, or 5 hosts, separated by the comma character (,). The master host is always a node in the ZooKeeper ensemble.

step.cmd: In separate windows, log in to each of the delegate hosts that are nodes in the ZooKeeper ensemble .
On all ensemble hosts, start serviced.
step.info: The window of time for starting a ZooKeeper ensemble is relatively short. The goal of this step is to start on each ensemble node at about the same time, so that each node can participate in electing the leader.

step.cmd: On the master host, check the status of the ZooKeeper ensemble.

substep.cmd: Attach to the container of the ZooKeeper service.
Query the master host and identify its role in the ensemble.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Master with the hostname or IP address of the master host: { echo stats; sleep 1; } | nc Master 2181 | grep Mode
substep.stepresult: The result includes leader or follower. When multiple hosts rely on the ZooKeeper instance on the master host, the result includes standalone.

substep.cmd: Query the other delegate hosts to identify their role in the ensemble.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Delegate with the hostname or IP address of a delegate host: { echo stats; sleep 1; } | nc Delegate 2181 | grep Mode

substep.cmd: Detach from the container of the ZooKeeper service.

step.stepresult: If none of the nodes reports that it is the ensemble leader within a few minutes of starting serviced, reboot the ensemble hosts.

step.cmd: Log in to each of the delegate hosts that are not nodes in the ZooKeeper ensemble , and then start serviced.

taskbody.postreq: Once is started, it is ready to start managing applications. For more information, refer to the documentation of your application.
